Posting during my vacation in Tokyo, I was at Sengakuji Temple two days ago. This is my 3rd visit there. I'm headed out to Osaka today. I'll be in Japan for another 6 days. 



Nina

From: matt_donya_carter <matt_donya_carter@...>

Sent: Fri, Aug 21, 2009 11:01 pm
Subject: [samuraihistory] Re: 47 ronin



 



Ken, 

There's a plaque hanging in the Sengakuji Temple with all 47 Ronin's names on it, if you can read japanese or know someone who can translate it for you. : 
http://jadkins.com/archive /sengakugi_temple_resting_place_of_the_47_ronin.html

Matt

> I believe there iss a full list in this book.
> 
> Allyn,
> J.. (1970). The 47 Ronin story. North Clarendon,
> Vermont: Tuttle Publishing: An Imprint of Periplus Editions (HK) Ltd.
> 
> Its 'faction', in that he took the known facts and added fiction in the form
> of dialogue to make a novel but i think he has a list in the back, i don't
> have it with me to check though.
> 
> Cheers R
